Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2012 03:57PM - edited Nov 5, 2012 04:04PM by Dori1 I understand about your fear.  I had my biopsy this past Friday.  The numbing med wasn't that bad and all I felt was a little pressure when the doctor took the samples.  Because your husband can't be in the room, maybe having a nurse there to offer support will help.  A nurse held my hand through the procedure and talked to me to keep me calm.  I was a little sore after but Tylenol helped with the pain.  Sending a prayer.
Posts.Title: Awaiting biopsy to diagnose cancer; worried and sad rlwh rlwh
